amendment.description: Amendment requires the CIA to submit an annual report to Congress that describes the level of cooperation and assistance provided to domestic Federal law enforcement agencies by the intelligence community relating to the effort to stop the flow of illegal drugs into the United States through the United States-Mexico border and the United States-Canada border.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 3 in the Congressional Record of May 6, 1998 to direct the Director of Central Intelligence to report annually to Congress on support the intelligence community has provided to federal law enforcement agencies in their efforts to stop the flow of drugs from crossing the Mexican and Canadian borders.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Traficant amendment (A003) Agreed to by voice vote.
